message: We're so excited to have Jay on the show this Tuesday. What would you like to know about Local Motors? Let us know here or on Twitter at @TWIStartups
And yes, the car will be on the show :)
Jay Rogers is driving to LA from Phoenix in a Local Motors Rally Fighter -- here's a clip of the RF in action: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hKmrgZse7m4
looking forward for todays show
Jay: Are there plans to build micro-factories in other cities? Would you partner with existing custom body-shops or otherwise?

I love how they encourage learning with "tutorial" links. But the users of this site seem to be kind of advanced... are there any "pre-requisites" needed prior to becoming a part of a car-building project? In other words how does a novice designer participate?
Great question, we'll give that one to Jason.
ahhh sweet!

How long is the car building/developing process? Is there any video on the site to showcase the manufacturing? My husband is a car nut (just like everyother man I know) who would love to contribute and be able to watch the progress. Hey Jason maybe a "ThisWeekIn Cars"?
@Mpressme -- good one, adding that to the list now.
@Mpressme -- will add your followup questions. There actually used to be a TWI Cars show: http://thisweekin.com/thisweekin-cars/
did he have to upgrade the engine to serve the wheels?
What does Jason think about he success of the domain : local-motors.com and why not buy "localmotors.com"  ?
thx, the fastest it goes as well!

I am a big fan of Local Motors (Massachusetts Companies Represent!). Been following them since the early days. A lot of car companies seem to bridge into other areas like merchandise, branded clothing, and lately - video games. Does the way Local Motors operates restrict that kind of brand exercise? PS - I'll take my Boston Bullet in polished aluminum and hope you don't it mind that it will spend most days in Worcester instead.
@kirinkalia Thanks! A fan of both really. Car Guy / Entrepreneur through and through!

First. Manage your accounts, like fb, twitter, youtube, vimeo, flickr, gmail, foursquare in one place
Second. The system will use A.I. to learn about your interests and when you search something, like a trip or a restaurant or whatever, Wup will show results with more relevance using web semantic.
